info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 4:22AM CDT until August 12 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CALHOUN...WESTERN MADISON...SOUTHWESTERN MACOUPIN AND JERSEY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS...ST. CHARLES... NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...EAST CENTRAL FRANKLIN AND ST. LOUIS COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI AND ST. LOUIS CITY... At 421 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Elsberry to near St. Paul to near Treloar, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 403 AM, news media reported trees down in Troy Missouri. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... St. Louis, O`Fallon, St. Charles, St. Peters, Florissant, Chesterfield, Wildwood, University City, Ballwin, Wentzville, Alton, Kirkwood, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood, Webster Groves, Ferguson, Arnold, Manchester, Godfrey, and Creve Coeur. This also includes Babler Memorial State Park, Scott Joplin Historic Site, Route 66 State Park, Castlewood State Park, Confluence State Park, Mastodon Historic Site, First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site, and Pere Marquette State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 257 and 277. Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 185 and 191. Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 203 and 231. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
